article.Heading: This year's Budget different for three reasons, says Jaitley
article.Summary: The Finance Minister said advancing the date of the Budget, merging the Rail Budget with the Union Budget, and doing away with the classification of plan and non-plan expenditure were three major reforms.
article.Body:
Moneycontrol Bureau

In his Budget speech in Parliament on Wednesday, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley said the Union Budget 2017-18 contained three major reforms.

He said the advancement of the date of the Budget, which is usually presented at the end of February, would enable Parliament to vote on the Budget before the end of the current financial year. As a result, ministries would be able to operationalise new schemes and projects right from the start of the next financial year itself.

Jaitley said the merger of the Railway Budget and the Union Budget did away with a 'colonial practice' and brings Railways to the forefront of the government's fiscal policy and enable multi-modal planning between railways, highways and inland waterways. He added, however, that the financial autonomy of the Railways would remain. 

He also said that the government's decision to do away with the classification of plan and non-plan expenditure would faciliate optimum allocation of resources.
